listitem.para: a pointer to a Cholesky factorization

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: This function may be used to know basic information about the Cholesky factor created with taucs_chfact :

listitem.para: first OK is %t if C_ptr is a valid pointer to an Cholesky factorization (and %f else)
if OK is %t then n and cnz are respectively the matrix order and the number of non zeros elements in the supernodal structure storing C ; if OK is %f, n and cnz are set to the void matrix [].

refsection.title: Details
refsection.para: Due to the supernodal structure used for C, cnz is larger than the exact number of non-zeros elements in C (and so this cnz is a measure of the memory used internally). To get the exact cnz you may retrieve the Cholesky factor with taucs_chget then apply the nnz scilab function (see the 2d example in taucs_chget).
